gurmukhi: moqnhwr hIry Aru mwnk dyvq hY Br pwnn bory ] kMcn rokn ky ghny giV dyq khY su bcy suq mory ]221]
transliteration: Motanhaar Hdere Ar(u) Maanak Devat Hai Bhar Paanan Bore|| Kanchanndrokan Ke Gadne Gad(i) Det Kahai Su Bache Sout More||221||
translation: The bags filled with necklaces of diamonds, jewels and gems were given and giving the golden ornaments, the mother Yashoda prays that her son be protected.221.
Now begins the description of the forest-fire

gurmukhi: hoie pRsMin sBY biRj ky jn rYn pry Gr BIqir soey ] Awg lgI su idSw ibidSw miD jwg qbY iqh qy fr hoey ]
transliteration: Hoe Prasann(i) Sabhai Brij Ke Jan Rain Dare Ghar Bheetar(i) Soe|| Oog Lagisu Dishaa Bidishaa Madh(i) Jaag Tabai Tih Te Dar Hoe||
translation: All the people of Braja, being pleased, slept in their homes at night; the fire broke out at night in all directions and all became afraid;

gurmukhi: r`C krY hmrI hir jI ieh ic`q ibcwr qhwN khu hoey ] diRg bwq khI krunwinD mIc lXo ieqnY su qaU duK Koey ]222]
transliteration: Rachchh Darai Hamrihar(i) Jieh Chitt Bichaar Tahaan Kauh Hoe|| Drig Baat Kahikarounaanidh Meech Layo Itnai Su Taoo Doukh Khoe||222||
translation: All of them thought that they would be protected by Krishna; Krishna told them to close their eyes, so that all their sufferings may end.222.

gurmukhi: mIc ley diRg jau sBhI nr pwn krXo hirjI hir dO qau ] doK imtwie dXo pur ko sB hI jn ky mn ko hn dXo Bau ]
transliteration: Meech Lae Drig Jau Sabh-hinar Paan Daryo Har(i)jihar(i) Dau Tau|| Dokh Mitaae Dayo Pur Ko Dabh Hijan Ke Man Ko Han Dayo Bhau||
translation: As soon as all the people closed their eyes, Krishna drank the whole fire; he removed all their sufferings and fears;

gurmukhi: icMq kCU nih hY iqh ko ijn ko krunwinD dUr krY Kau ] dUr krI qpqw iqh kI jnu fwr dXo jl ko Cl kY rau ]223]
transliteration: Cheent Kachhodh Nah(i) Hai Tih Ko Jin Ko Karounaanidh Door Darai Khau|| Door Karitaptaa Tih Kijan(u) Daar Dayo Jal Ko Chhal Kai Rau||223||
translation: They whose agony is removed by Krishna, how can they remain anxious for anything? The heat of all was cooled don as if they were cooled by washing in the waves of water.223.

gurmukhi: AwK imtvwie mhw bpu ko bFwie Aiq suK mn pwie Awg Kwie gXo swvrw ] lokn kI r`Cn ky kwj krunw ky iniD mhwN Cl kir ky bcwie lXo gwvrw ]
transliteration: Ookh Mitvaae Mahaa Bap(u) Ko Badhaae At(i) Soukh Man Paae Aag Khaae Gado Saavraa|| Lokan Kirachchhan Ke Kaaj Karounaa Ke Nidh(i) Mahaan Chhal Kar(i) Ke Bachaae Layo Gadvraa||
translation: By getting the eyes of the people closed and expanding his body in endless pleasure, Krishna devoured all the fire; For the protection of the people, the benevolent Lord, through great deception has saved the city.

gurmukhi: khY kib sXwm iqn kwm krXo duKu kir qwko Pun PYl rhXo dso ids nwvrw ] idsit bcwie swQ dwqn cbwie so qo gXo hY pcwie jYsy Kyly swNg bwvrw ]224]
transliteration: Kahai Kahi Syaam Tin Kaam Daryo Doukh(u)) Kar(i) Taako Phoun Phai Rahyo Daso Dis Naavraa|| Disttee Bachaae Saath Daatan Chadhaae So To Gado Hai Pachaae Jaise Khele Saan Baavraa||224||
translation: The poet Shyam says that Krishna did a very difficult task and with this his name spread in all the ten directions and all this work was done like a juggler, who chews and digests all, keeping himself out of sight.224.

gurmukhi: ieiq kiRSnwvqwr dwvwnl qy bcYbo brnnM ]
transliteration: It(i) Krishnaavataar Daavaanal Te Bachaibo Barnanaan||
translation: End of the description regarding the protection from forest-fire in Krishnavatara.
Now begins the description of playing Holi with the gopas
